function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Concentration of malaria deaths in sub-Saharan Africa","Impact":"High number of deaths, especially in vulnerable populations","Mitigation":"Increased investment in malaria intervention programs","Technologies":"Malaria prevention and treatment technologies","People":"Populations in sub-Saharan Africa","Owner":"International agencies, governments, and NGOs"},{"Description":"Lack of long-term financial sustainability for malaria intervention programs","Impact":"Reduction in funding and program effectiveness","Mitigation":"Developing sustainable funding models, seeking private sector partnerships","Technologies":"Financial planning and management tools","People":"USAID, WHO, Wellcome Trust, Roll Back Malaria Group, Presidential Malaria Initiative, Global Fund","Owner":"International agencies, governments, and NGOs"},{"Description":"Opposing trend of decreasing malaria cases and increasing costs for prevention","Impact":"Financial burden, potential decrease in intervention effectiveness","Mitigation":"Improved cost-effective prevention strategies, quality assurance for interventions","Technologies":"Cost-effective malaria prevention technologies, intervention monitoring tools","People":"Populations at risk of malaria, public health organizations","Owner":"International agencies, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Quality-related concerns over drug efficacy, safety, and surveillance","Impact":"Potential decrease in intervention effectiveness, drug resistance","Mitigation":"Enhanced surveillance, drug development, and safety regulations","Technologies":"Drug quality testing tools, surveillance technologies, drug development technologies","People":"Healthcare professionals, populations at risk of malaria","Owner":"Health organizations, regulatory agencies"},{"Description":"Inadequate approach to managing the risk of vector-borne diseases like malaria","Impact":"Lack of transformative impact on disease elimination","Mitigation":"Development of innovative strategies, alignment with UN SDGs and global agendas","Technologies":"Innovative disease prevention technologies, urban planning tools","People":"Populations at risk of vector-borne diseases","Owner":"International agencies, governments, and NGOs"}]}
